title: Mark Aguiar - Wikipedia
snippet: He then went on to graduate study at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, where he received a PhD in economics in 1999, writing a thesis titled The Information Content of Asset Prices and Emerging Market Crises under the direction of Ricardo J. Caballero and Daron Acemoglu. Aguiar was an assistant professor of economics at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business between 1999 and 2004, a senior economist at the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston from 2004 to 2006, and a tenured associate professor of economics at the University of Rochester from 2006 to 2011.

title: Mark Aguiar | Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis
snippet: Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis: ... that works for all of us. ... Mark Aguiar is a consultant at the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis and the Walker Professor of Economics and International Finance at Princeton University.

title: Mark A. Aguiar
snippet: Mark A. Aguiar is the Walker Professor of Economics and International Finance in the Department of Economics at Princeton University. Aguiar co-directs the Griswold Center for Economic Policy Studies (GCEPS).

title: Mark A. Aguiar - Princeton University
